thread.title: Jr. Blues grab fourth straight victory
thread.title_full: Jr. Blues grab fourth straight victory

author: Staff report
title: Jr. Blues grab fourth straight victory
text: Jr. Blues grab fourth straight victory Comment Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 9:59 PM By Staff report Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 9:59 PM LACROSSE, Wis. — Anthony Scarsella and Anthony Mangano each scored a goal while goalkeeper Nikko Della Maggiore earned the shutout as the Springfield Junior Blues got their fourth straight North American Hockey League victory with a 2-0 win over the Coulee Region Chill Saturday night. The Junior Blues (6-2-0) conclude the two-game series against the Chill at 5 p.m. Sunday. They opened the three-game trip with a 2-1 victory at Janesville on Friday. After a scoreless first period Saturday, Scarsella gave the Junior Blues a 1-0 lead on a power-play goal assisted by Trevor Stone and Brady Tomlak with just 55 seconds left in the second period. It was Springfield’s only power play of the game. Mangano quickly made it 2-0, scoring on assists from Stone and Joe Immormino just 40 seconds into the third period. The Chill outshot the Junior Blues 35-32, with Della Maggiore turning away all 35 shots en route to his first shutout of the season. Coulee Region was 0-for-3 on the power play. After Sunday’s series finale at Coulee Region, Springfield plays at Topeka next Friday and Saturday. By Staff report
